subtitle: paper 167 the visit to philadelphia
throughout this period of the pre and
ministry when mentioned is made of jesus
and the apostles visiting the various
localities
where the seventy were at work it should
be recalled that as a rule
only ten were with him since it was the
practice to leave at least two of the

peter and his brother andrew

when the master left the camped at pella

it was not uncommon for them three to

when he arrived at philadelphia he was

miracles had attended the recent
preaching tour through the decapolis
and expecting the cleansing of the ten
lepers thus far there had been no
miracles on this pre and mission
this was a period when the gospel was
proclaimed with power without miracles
and most of the time
without the personal presence of jesus
or even of his apostles
jesus and the ten apostles arrived at
philadelphia on wednesday february 22
and spent thursday and friday resting
from their recent travels and labors
that friday night james spoke in the
synagogue and a general counsel was
called for the following evening
they were much rejoiced over the
progress of the gospel at philadelphia
and among the nearby villages the
messengers of david also brought word of
the further advancement of the kingdom

as well as good news from alexandria and
damascus
breakfast for the pharisees there lived
in philadelphia a very wealthy and
influential pharisee who had accepted
the teaching of abner
and who invited jesus to his house
sabbath morning for breakfast
it was known that jesus was expected in

so a large number of visitors among them
many pharisees had come over from

there came into the room one of the

abner washed his hands at the beginning

near the end of the meal there came in

he made no request of jesus for healing

you can perceive that it would be like

my brethren
when you are bitten to a marriage feast

the jews were in the habit of bearing

this was a necessary practice in such a

it often happened that they put in the
